READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 448, 787, 464]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name in the spaces at the top of this page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 464, 322, 479]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 479, 504, 495]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 495, 504, 510]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 510, 380, 525]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 539, 910, 570]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions in the space provided. If additional space is required, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet. The question number(s) must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 570, 910, 600]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 600, 598, 615]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 615, 608, 630]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 644, 756, 694]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together. The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question. The total number of marks for this paper is 50.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
Each of a group of 10 boys estimates the length of a piece of string. The estimates, in centimetres, are as follows.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[255, 114, 791, 135]]<|/det|>
37 40 45 38 36 38 42 38 40 39

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 146, 282, 164]]<|/det|>

<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
The volume of soup in Super Soup cartons has a normal distribution with mean \(\mu\) millilitres and standard deviation 9 millilitres. Tests have shown that \(10\%\) of cartons contain less than 440 millilitres of soup. Find the value of \(\mu\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 103, 920, 122]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 541, 186, 560]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 541, 920, 576]]<|/det|>
A food retailer orders 150 Super Soup cartons. Calculate the number of these cartons for which you would expect the volume of soup to be more than 1.8 standard deviations above the mean.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 573, 920, 592]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 74, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 120, 156, 138]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 120, 542, 139]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 660, 191, 678]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 660, 594, 680]]<|/det|>
You are given that \(\mathrm{E}(X) = \frac{6}{7}\). Find the value of \(\mathrm{Var}(X)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 660, 920, 678]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

Donna has 2 necklaces, 8 rings and 4 bracelets, all different. She chooses 4 pieces of jewellery. How many possible selections can she make if she chooses at least 1 necklace and at least 1 bracelet?
